query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Sì tosto come l’ultima parola 2 la benedetta fiamma per dir tolse, 3 a rotar cominciò la santa mola;
query.error: **English:** 1 As soon as the last word 2 the blessed flame took to say, 3 the holy millstone began to turn;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e nel suo giro tutta non si volse 5 prima ch’un’altra di cerchio la chiuse, 6 e moto a moto e canto a canto colse;
query.error: **English:** 4 and in its turning it did not revolve completely 5 before another enclosed it in a circle, 6 and movement by movement and song by song it gathered;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 canto che tanto vince nostre muse, 8 nostre serene in quelle dolci tube, 9 quanto primo splendor quel ch’e’ refuse.
query.error: **English:** 7 a song that so surpasses our muses, 8 our sirens in those sweet trumpets, 9 as the first splendor surpasses that which it rejects.
query.result: 7 sang ðe swa miclum oferclyfeð ure musan, 8 ure meremæden on ðam swetan swegum, 9 swa ðæs formeste beorhtoðe ðæt ðe hit forsoc.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Come si volgon per tenera nube 11 due archi paralelli e concolori, 12 quando Iunone a sua ancella iube,
query.error: **English:** 10 As through a tender cloud two bows arise, 11 parallel and of like colors, 12 when Juno commands her handmaid,
query.result: 10 Swa swa ðurh hluttre wolcne twegen bogan 11 efenlice and efenheowe, 12 ðonne Iuno hire ðinenne het,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 nascendo di quel d’entro quel di fori, 14 a guisa del parlar di quella vaga 15 ch’amor consunse come sol vapori,
query.error: **English:** 13 the outer born of that within, 14 in the manner of the speech of that fair one 15 whom love consumed as the sun does vapors,
query.result: 13 ðæt ðæt uttre of ðam innan bearn, 14 on ðære wisan ðæs wordes ðære fægran, 15 ðe lufe fordyde swa sunne ða mistas,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 e fanno qui la gente esser presaga, 17 per lo patto che Dio con Noè puose, 18 del mondo che già mai più non s’allaga:
query.error: **English:** 16 and here make people aware, 17 because of the covenant that God made with Noah, 18 that the world will never again be flooded:
query.result: 16 and her ða leode warnian, 17 ðurh ðone gehat ðe God Noen sette, 18 ðæs middangeardes ðe næfre eft ne bið:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 così di quelle sempiterne rose 20 volgiensi circa noi le due ghirlande, 21 e sì l’estrema a l’intima rispuose.
query.error: **English:** 19 so did the two garlands of those eternal roses 20 revolve around us, 21 and so the outermost answered to the innermost.
query.result: 19 swa ða twegen beagas ðæra ecena rosa 20 ymb us bugon, 21 and swa ðæt ytmeste ðam innestan andwyrde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Poi che ’l tripudio e l’altra festa grande, 23 sì del cantare e sì del fiammeggiarsi 24 luce con luce gaudïose e blande,
query.error: **English:** 22 After the jubilation and the other great feast, 23 both of the singing and of the flaming, 24 light with light joyful and gentle,
query.result: 22 Æfter ðæm gefean and ðæm oðrum miclan mærðe, 23 ge ðæs singan ge ðæs fyrbrynes, 24 leoht mid leohte glædlic and blíðe,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 insieme a punto e a voler quetarsi, 26 pur come li occhi ch’al piacer che i move 27 conviene insieme chiudere e levarsi;
query.error: **English:** 25 together at the point and at the will to be quiet, 26 just like the eyes that to the pleasure that moves them 27 must close and lift themselves together;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 del cor de l’una de le luci nove 29 si mosse voce, che l’ago a la stella 30 parer mi fece in volgermi al suo dove;
query.error: **English:** 28 from the heart of one of the new lights 29 a voice moved, which made the needle to the star 30 seem to me in turning to its place;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 e cominciò: «L’amor che mi fa bella 32 mi tragge a ragionar de l’altro duca 33 per cui del mio sì ben ci si favella.
query.error: **English:** 31 and it began: "The love that makes me beautiful 32 draws me to speak of the other leader 33 through whom my leader is spoken of so well.
query.result: 31 and ðus ongan: "Se lufu ðe me fæger wyrð 32 teohhoð me to sprecanne be ðæm óðrum heretogan 33 ðurh ðone mín swa wel ymbe spræc."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Degno è che, dov’ è l’un, l’altro s’induca: 35 sì che, com’ elli ad una militaro, 36 così la gloria loro insieme luca.
query.error: **English:** 34 It is fitting that where one is, the other should be brought: 35 so that, just as he shone in a single battle, 36 so their glory may shine together.
query.result: 34 Riht is ðæt ðær ðær oðer bið, ðæt ðær oder sie: 35 swa ðæt, swa he on anum feohtan sceán, 36 swa heora wuldor samod scíne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 L’essercito di Cristo, che sì caro 38 costò a rïarmar, dietro a la ’nsegna 39 si movea tardo, sospeccioso e raro,
query.error: **English:** 37 The army of Christ, which it cost so dear 38 to rearm, moved behind the standard 39 slowly, suspiciously, and sparsely,
query.result: 37 Cristes fyrd, ðe swa dyre geboht, 38 æfter ðære guðfanon gearwe wæs, 39 ferde ða forð miclum and latum,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 quando lo ’mperador che sempre regna 41 provide a la milizia, ch’era in forse, 42 per sola grazia, non per esser degna;
query.error: **English:** 40 when the emperor who reigns forever 41 provided for the army, which was in doubt, 42 by grace alone, not because it was worthy;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 e, come è detto, a sua sposa soccorse 44 con due campioni, al cui fare, al cui dire 45 lo popol disvïato si raccorse.
query.error: **English:** 43 and, as it is said, he came to the aid of his bride 44 with two champions, by whose deeds and words 45 the straying people were brought back together.
query.result: 43 and, swa swa us secgað ða halgan gewritu, 44 his bryde he gefultumede ðurh twegen cempan, ðurh ðara word and ðurh ðara weorc 45 ðæt folc, ðe ær wæs forloren, eft to ðam rihtan wege gecyrde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 In quella parte ove surge ad aprire 47 Zefiro dolce le novelle fronde 48 di che si vede Europa rivestire,
query.error: **English:** 46 In that part where Zephyr arises to open 47 the new leaves sweetly, 48 with which Europe is seen to reclothe herself,
query.result: 46 On ðære healfe ðær Zephyrus arist to ontýnenne 47 ða niwan leaf swétlice, 48 ðurh ðæt Europa is geséwen oferwrigen,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 non molto lungi al percuoter de l’onde 50 dietro a le quali, per la lunga foga, 51 lo sol talvolta ad ogne uom si nasconde,
query.error: **English:** 49 not far from the beating of the waves 50 behind which, because of the long pursuit, 51 the sun sometimes hides itself from every man,
query.result: 49 nis ná swíðe feor fram ðæs wæges hryre 50 æfter ðæm ðe, for ðære langen fyrste, 51 ðe sunne hwilum æghwylcum men bihýð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 siede la fortunata Calaroga 53 sotto la protezion del grande scudo 54 in che soggiace il leone e soggioga:
query.error: **English:** 52 sits fortunate Calaroga, 53 under the protection of the great shield 54 in which the lion is subject and subjugates:
query.result: 52 sítt ðæt gesælige Calaroga, 53 under ðæs myclan scyldes werunge 54 on ðæm ðe ðe leó ðeowiað and ofercυμαð:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 dentro vi nacque l’amoroso drudo 56 de la fede cristiana, il santo atleta 57 benigno a’ suoi e a’ nemici crudo;
query.error: **English:** 55 within was born the amorous lover 56 of the Christian faith, the holy athlete, 57 benign to his own and cruel to his enemies;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 e come fu creata, fu repleta 59 sì la sua mente di viva vertute 60 che, ne la madre, lei fece profeta.
query.error: **English:** 58 and as soon as he was created, his mind was so filled 59 with living virtue 60 that, even in his mother's womb, it made him a prophet.
query.result: 58 and swa swa he wæs gesceapen, he wæs gefylled 59 swa his mód mid lybbendre mihte 60 ðæt, on ðære módor, hine geworhte witegan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Poi che le sponsalizie fuor compiute 62 al sacro fonte intra lui e la Fede, 63 u’ si dotar di mutüa salute,
query.error: **English:** 61 After the marriage was completed 62 at the sacred font between him and Faith, 63 where they endowed each other with mutual salvation,
query.result: 61 Þa wæs gefylled ðara fædera gehat 62 æt ðam halgan wæge betwux him and ðære Geleafan, 63 þær hi him betwux burgum trymedon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 la donna che per lui l’assenso diede, 65 vide nel sonno il mirabile frutto 66 ch’uscir dovea di lui e de le rede;
query.error: **English:** 64 the woman who gave her consent for him, 65 saw in a dream the miraculous fruit 66 that was to come from him and his descendants;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 e perché fosse qual era in costrutto, 68 quinci si mosse spirito a nomarlo 69 del possessivo di cui era tutto.
query.error: **English:** 67 and so that it would be as it was in construction, 68 a spirit moved from here to name him 69 with the possessive of which he was all.
query.result: 67 and þæt hit wære swa hit wæs on gesceaft, 68 þanon wæs astyred gast to nemnanne 69 ðone agendne ðæs þe he eal wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Domenico fu detto; e io ne parlo 71 sì come de l’agricola che Cristo 72 elesse a l’orto suo per aiutarlo.
query.error: **English:** 70 He was called Dominic; and I speak of him 71 as of the husbandman whom Christ 72 chose for His garden to help Him.
query.result: 70 Dominicus wæs gehāten; and ic be him sprece 71 swā swā be ðǣm bēowmanne ðe Crist 72 geceas tō his ortgearde him tō fylstenne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Ben parve messo e famigliar di Cristo: 74 che ’l primo amor che ’n lui fu manifesto, 75 fu al primo consiglio che diè Cristo.
query.error: **English:** 73 He seemed well a messenger and familiar of Christ: 74 for the first love that was manifest in him, 75 was at the first counsel that Christ gave.
query.result: 73 He wel licode ðæs Hælendes boda: 74 ðæt æreste ðæt he on him geswutelode, 75 wæs ðæt æreste geþeaht ðe Crist gesette.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Spesse fïate fu tacito e desto 77 trovato in terra da la sua nutrice, 78 come dicesse: ‘Io son venuto a questo’.
query.error: **English:** 76 Often he was silent and awake, 77 found on the ground by his nurse, 78 as if to say: ‘I have come to this’.
query.result: 76 Oft he wæs on niht swiðe gedrefed, 77 on ðære moldan his modor gesohte, 78 swilce he sæde: ‘Ic eom to ðisum life cumen’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Oh padre suo veramente Felice! 80 oh madre sua veramente Giovanna, 81 se, interpretata, val come si dice!
query.error: **English:** 79 Oh his father, truly happy! 80 Oh his mother, truly Joan, 81 if, interpreted, it means what is said!
query.result: 79 Eala fæder his, soðlice gesælig! 80 Eala modor his, soðlice Iohanne, 81 gif hit swa is, swa hit man segð, gerecced!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Non per lo mondo, per cui mo s’affanna 83 di retro ad Ostïense e a Taddeo, 84 ma per amor de la verace manna
query.error: **English:** 82 Not for the world, for which now they toil 83 behind Ostiensis and Taddeo, 84 but for love of the true manna
query.result: 82 Nis for ðære worulde, for ðære hi nu winnað 83 æfter Ostiense and æfter Taddeo, 84 ac for ðære soðan heofonlican metes lufe

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 in picciol tempo gran dottor si feo; 86 tal che si mise a circüir la vigna 87 che tosto imbianca, se ’l vignaio è reo.
query.error: **English:** 85 in a short time he became a great doctor; 86 so much so that he set out to tend the vineyard 87 that quickly turns white if the vine-dresser is bad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 E a la sedia che fu già benigna 89 più a’ poveri giusti, non per lei, 90 ma per colui che siede, che traligna,
query.error: **English:** 88 And to the Chair that was once kind 89 to the just poor, not through its own merit, 90 but through him who sits in it, who has degenerated,
query.result: 88 And to ðære setle ðe wæs ða georn 89 ðæm earmum rihtwisum, na for ðære æ, 90 ac for ðam ðe ðæron sitteð, ðe awende,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 non dispensare o due o tre per sei, 92 non la fortuna di prima vacante, 93 non decimas, quae sunt pauperum Dei,
query.error: **English:** 91 it did not ask to dispense two or three for six, 92 nor the first vacant benefice, 93 nor tithes, which are the patrimony of God's poor,
query.result: 91 ne bed he ðær twa ða for sixe, 92 ne ðære forman fægere mede, 93 ne ða teoðunge, ða synd ðæra earmra Godes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 addimandò, ma contro al mondo errante 95 licenza di combatter per lo seme 96 del qual ti fascian ventiquattro piante.
query.error: **English:** 94 but asked only, against the erring world, 95 permission to fight for the seed 96 from which twenty-four plants twine around you.
query.result: 94 ac bæd ðæt he moste, ongean ðone gedwolan, 95 feohtan for ðam sæde, ðe ðe ða syx and twentig 96 bewindað ða plantað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Poi, con dottrina e con volere insieme, 98 con l’officio appostolico si mosse 99 quasi torrente ch’alta vena preme;
query.error: **English:** 97 Then, with learning and with will together, 98 with the apostolic office he moved 99 like a torrent that a high spring drives;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 e ne li sterpi eretici percosse 101 l’impeto suo, più vivamente quivi 102 dove le resistenze eran più grosse.
query.error: **English:** 100 and among the heretical thickets 101 his impetus struck, more fiercely there 102 where the resistance was strongest.
query.result: 100 and on ða hæðenan heowum he sloh 101 his ellen ðær ðær ða mæstan wæron 102 ða oferhygdo ðe ðær wæron mæste.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Di lui si fecer poi diversi rivi 104 onde l’orto catolico si riga, 105 sì che i suoi arbuscelli stan più vivi.
query.error: **English:** 103 From him then sprang various streams 104 by which the Catholic garden is watered, 105 so that its shrubs grow more lively.
query.result: 103 Of him siððan feala frumra wæron 104 ðara ðe ðone cyrcan healice rihtað, 105 swa ðæt ða telgan ðe ðær on spryttað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Se tal fu l’una rota de la biga 107 in che la Santa Chiesa si difese 108 e vinse in campo la sua civil briga,
query.error: **English:** 106 Such was one wheel of the chariot 107 in which the Holy Church defended herself 108 and won her civil strife in the field,
query.result: 106 Swylc wæs ðære bigan an hweol 107 on ðære ðe seo halige cyrce hire wearð 108 and oferwann on felda hire agen gefeoht,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 ben ti dovrebbe assai esser palese 110 l’eccellenza de l’altra, di cui Tomma 111 dinanzi al mio venir fu sì cortese.
query.error: **English:** 109 the excellence of the other should be very clear to you, 110 of which Thomas, 111 before my coming, was so courteous.
query.result: 109 ðe oðres mærðe ðe sceolde wel wesan 110 cuð and gecyðed, ðæs ðe Thomas 111 ær minum tocyme wæs swiðe georn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Ma l’orbita che fé la parte somma 113 di sua circunferenza, è derelitta, 114 sì ch’è la muffa dov’ era la gromma.
query.error: **English:** 112 But the orbit that made the highest part 113 of its circumference is abandoned, 114 so that there is mold where there was once the sprout.
query.result: 112 Ac se weg ðe ða heanestan dæl 113 his ymbhwyrftes geworhte, is forleten, 114 swa ðæt ðær is ða mohða ðær ða gromas wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 La sua famiglia, che si mosse dritta 116 coi piedi a le sue orme, è tanto volta, 117 che quel dinanzi a quel di retro gitta;
query.error: **English:** 115 His family, which moved straight ahead 116 with their feet in his footsteps, is so turned around, 117 that the one in front kicks the one behind;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 e tosto si vedrà de la ricolta 119 de la mala coltura, quando il loglio 120 si lagnerà che l’arca li sia tolta.
query.error: **English:** 118 and soon the harvest of the bad cultivation will be seen, 119 when the darnel will complain that the threshing floor is taken from it.
query.result: 118 and ða bið ðære yflan tiliunge 119 ðære sædes ripes hraðe gesyne, ðonne ðæt loðene 120 clypað ðæt hit ðære berne benumen sie.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Ben dico, chi cercasse a foglio a foglio 122 nostro volume, ancor troveria carta 123 u’ leggerebbe “I’ mi son quel ch’i’ soglio”;
query.error: **English:** 121 I say indeed, that whoever should search leaf by leaf 122 our volume, would still find a page 123 where he would read “I am what I am accustomed to being”;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 ma non fia da Casal né d’Acquasparta, 125 là onde vegnon tali a la scrittura, 126 ch’uno la fugge e altro la coarta.
query.error: **English:** 124 but it will not be from Casale or Acquasparta, 125 from where such people come to write, 126 that one flees from it and another restricts it.
query.result: 124 ac he ne bið na of Casal ne of Acquasparta, 125 ðanon cuðað swylce men to ðære write, 126 ðæt an ðære fliho and oðer ðære wiðstent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Io son la vita di Bonaventura 128 da Bagnoregio, che ne’ grandi offici 129 sempre pospuosi la sinistra cura.
query.error: **English:** 127 I am the life of Bonaventure 128 from Bagnoregio, who in high offices 129 always set aside the concern for the left hand.
query.result: 127 Ic eom ðæt lif Bonauenture 128 of Bagnoregio, se ðe on heahum ðingum 129 symble forðiðe ðæs wynstran geðoht.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Illuminato e Augustin son quici, 131 che fuor de’ primi scalzi poverelli 132 che nel capestro a Dio si fero amici.
query.error: **English:** 130 Illuminato and Augustine are here, 131 who were among the first poor barefoot friars 132 who made themselves friends of God in the capuche.
query.result: 130 Illuminatus and Augustinus syndonher, 131 ða wæron of ðæm ærestan scalde pearfum heora lichoman, 132 ða ðurh ðone capestro Gode wurdon freond.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Ugo da San Vittore è qui con elli, 134 e Pietro Mangiadore e Pietro Spano, 135 lo qual giù luce in dodici libelli;
query.error: **English:** 133 Hugh of Saint Victor is here with them, 134 and Peter Comestor and Peter of Spain, 135 who shines below in twelve volumes;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Natàn profeta e ’l metropolitano 137 Crisostomo e Anselmo e quel Donato 138 ch’a la prim’ arte degnò porre mano.
query.error: **English:** 136 Nathan the prophet and the metropolitan 137 Chrysostom and Anselm and that Donatus 138 who deigned to put his hand to the first art.
query.result: 136 Nathan the prophet and the metropolitan 137 Chrysostom and Anselm and that Donatus 138 who deigned to put his hand to the first art.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Rabano è qui, e lucemi dallato 140 il calavrese abate Giovacchino 141 di spirito profetico dotato.
query.error: **English:** 139 Here is Rabanus, and beside me shines 140 the Calabrian abbot Joachim, 141 endowed with prophetic spirit.
query.result: 139 Her is Rabanus, and me lihteð be sidan 140 se Calabrische abbot Iocachim, 141 witegastes gastes geweorðod.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Ad inveggiar cotanto paladino 143 mi mosse l’infiammata cortesia 144 di fra Tommaso e ’l discreto latino;
query.error: **English:** 142 To rouse such a paladin to action, 143 the burning courtesy of Brother Thomas 144 and his wise Latin moved me;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 e mosse meco questa compagnia».
query.error: **English:** 145 and this company moved with me."
query.result: 145 andmeðmeðferdeðeosgefærscipe."
